title: Elburton Villa F.C.
text:
Elburton Villa Football Club is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Elburton">Elburton Village</a>, <a href="Plymouth">Plymouth</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. They are currently members of the and play at Haye Road.
History.
The club was established in 1982 as a successor to Elburton Red Triangle FC. They joined the Plymouth & District League and went on to win the Division One title in 1990–91. In 1992 the club were founder members of the <a href="Devon%20County%20League">Devon County League</a>. The 1994–95 season saw the club win the league's Throgmorton Cup, beating Weston Mill Oak Villa in the final.
In 2007 the Devon County League merged with the <a href="South%20Western%20Football%20League">South Western League</a> to form the <a href="South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">South West Peninsula League</a>, with Elburton becoming members of the Premier Division. The club were relegated to Division One West after finishing bottom of the Premier Division in <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2015–16</a>. They were Division One West runners-up the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">following season</a>. In <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2017–18</a> the club finished third in Division One West and were promoted to the Premier Division in place of <a href="Stoke%20Gabriel%20A.F.C.">Stoke Gabriel</a>, who had requested to be relegated. Following league reorganisation at the end of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">2018–19 season</a>, they were placed in the Premier Division East.
Ground.
The club play at Haye Road, opposite the King George V Playing Fields which had been home to Elburton Red Triangle. Floodlights and a 50-seat stand were installed during the 2012–13 season. The ground hosts a canteen hut, limited bar, changing rooms and toilet facilities.
